page.title: 10LOUGH NEAGH
page.content:
{HABITAT:}On 3 occasions since 1846 the Lough level has been lowered.This has created an interesting variety of habitats along the edges of the old shorelines.With each lowering vegetation colonised the exposed ground and each step shows a progressive stage to the formation of natural forest.At present it includes reed swamp,fen and broadleaved scrub.
{INSECTS:}Each year in May Chironomids hatch out of Lough Neagh,swarming around the shoreline and making a walk impossible for the naturalist, birdwatcher or visitor.They do provide rich feeding for many species of bird at nesting time.
